description: CONVERSION OF FIRST FLOOR OF PREMISES TO USE AS A SELF- CONTAINED ONE BEDROOM FLAT UNIT AND THE INSTALLATION OF A NEW SHOPFRONT
decision_conditions: Condition : 1 - The development to which this permission relates must be begun not later than the expiration of 5 years, beginning with the date of this permission.  Reason for Condition: To comply with Section 91 of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990.

Condition : 2 - The floors and walls between each of the proposed dwellings and adjacent dwellings shall be so adapted as to achieve a reasonable resistance to airbourne sound and, where relevant, impact sound as far as is practical having regard to the existing construction. The insulation shall be in accordance with a scheme previously submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority prior to the commencement of works.  Reason for Condition: To ensure a satisfactory standard of residential amenity.

Condition : 3 - Details of the materials to be used in the shopfront shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority before any work is commenced.  Reason for Condition: To ensure a satisfactory appearance for the shopfront

Condition : 4 - The entrance door to the ground floor shop shall not be less than one metre wide and the threshold shall be at the same level as the pavement fronting the said entrance. Reason for Condition: To ensure adequate access for the disabled access.
